0.1.1.description:
# Bug fixes
- A message will now be shown when connection info lacks an IP address or slot name.
- Slot names and passwords with spaces in them can now be used by putting them in quotation marks.

0.10.0.description:
Tons of Client updates (and logic tweaks) thanks as always to @highrow623

* New file select menu and save management
  * Connecting now happens on the main menu when creating a new file or selecting an existing file
  * Each file is tied to a specific seed/slot, and have a renamable label making it easier to reconnect later
  * The mod checks compatibility with the apworld used to generate before loading into a save
  * Note: these changes make the mod incompatible with PseudoMenuMod since they both modify the main menu in a similar way, so make sure you don't also have that mod installed
* `spawn_point` yaml option: choose or randomize where you spawn into the game
  * This also affects where the `/spawn` command takes you
  * Certain restrictive spawns may start you with an item so you aren't immediately stuck
  * Dungeon start puts escaping through the dark rooms in logic even with obscure logic turned off
* Smaller mod updates
  * Added `/breaker` console command for recalling breaker in case you find yourself without it
  * Some general performance improvements: receiving a lot of messages at once (like when someone releases) should no longer cause the game to chug
  * Updated the console to have smaller text and a transparent background
  * Removed queue for displaying popups
  * Added client setting `settings.console.filters.item_send` for filtering which ItemSend messages are printed to the console
  * Fixed a bug that would make the game unresponsive if you went through a zone transition with the console open
* Logic updates
  * Fixed a lunatic logic rule that didn't require breaker for getting to the Keep throne room
  * Other small logic additions
0.10.0.title: Alt Spawns, Save Management, and Message Filtering

0.10.1.description:
Small client bugfix
* Fixed a bug that added Solar Wind to the player's inventory when receiving the Slide item

APWorld is completely unchanged (and only in this release as a convenience)
0.10.1.title: Slide Bugfix

0.2.0.description:
## Changes:
- Added small keys and minor upgrades to the item pool

## Bug Additions:
- Consumed small keys will be restored on every scene transition

0.3.0.description:
## Change List
- Health pieces are now shuffled.
- Location names for minor upgrades and small keys now attempt to describe the physical location rather than simply naming what's there in vanilla.

## Bug Fixes
- The mod will no longer confiscate abilities that you aren't supposed to have yet.
- Logic now acknowledges Heliacal Power.

0.3.1.description:
## Bug Fixes
- Logic for air kicks now actually checks if the player has Heliacal Power instead of just checking for Sun Greaves twice (Thanks dclaganiere).

0.3.2.description:
## Bug Fixes
- "Theatre - Murderous Goat" and "Theatre - Back Of Auditorium" locations are no longer swapped (Thanks Dawnfinder).

0.3.3.description:
## Bug Fixes
- Fixed issue where console commands weren't working on Proton and Wine, preventing the player from being able to connect (Thanks Chaos Witch Albrekka.)

0.4.0.description:
## Change List
- Display of messages from Archipelago has been reworked, and now uses mini-popups from the original game with the accompanying sound effect. Additionally, messages now use a queue instead of being sent all at once, so they won't extend off the top of your screen.
- Completion flag is now sent upon beating the game.
- "Underbelly - Alcove Behind Pillars" has been renamed to "Underbelly - Alcove Near Light".

## Bug Fixes
- Locations "Castle - Near Theatre Front" and "Castle - High Climb From Courtyard" are no longer swapped.
- Fixed an issue where Max HP would sometimes not update after reloading a file.

0.4.1.description:
## Bug fixes
- "Castle - Floater In Courtyard" now logically requires Heliacal or Sunsetter when using Ascendant Light.
- Accessing the main region of Theatre from Dungeon now requires Cling Gem with either Solar Wind or Sun Greaves.
(Thanks Br00ty and qwint for both of these.)

0.4.2.description:
## Bug fixes
- Changed the font in popups to one that properly displays non-latin characters (Thanks lioncache).

0.4.3.description:
## Bug fixes
- Fixed issue where, when connecting to an in-progress seed, already-checked locations would respawn on scene load except for in the map you first connected in (Thanks qwint).

0.4.4.description:
## Changes
- Message popups have been made smaller and moved closer to the bottom of the screen.
- Delay between messages has been increased, so only 2 can be on the screen at a time.
- Two console commands have been added to mute message sounds or stop them from appearing at all.
  - Enter `/messages mute` to mute or unmute message sounds.
  - Enter `/messages hide` to toggle in-game messages completely.
- The game completion flag in the apworld is now tied to an event, for easier backend integration with PopTracker.

0.4.5.description:
## Changes
- Logic no longer requires items for Underbelly - Ascendant Light or Dungeon - Alcove Near Mirror.
- Completing the game now writes to datastorage, for easier backend integration with PopTracker.

0.4.6.description:
## Bug fixes
- Includes slot number and game name as part of the datastorage key written on game completion, so PopTracker can tell the difference between players when game completion flags are sent.

0.5.0.description:
## Logic Rework
- The first piece of the logic rework is here! You have a couple of new options in the yaml, but they'll only apply to Castle Sansa; the logic for the rest of the game is the same as before.
  - New option: Logic Level. Higher levels require more tricks and more precise jumps. "Hard" is closest to the previous logic.
  - New option: Obscure Tricks. Enable paths and knowledge that aren't commonly known. Always enabled on Expert and Lunatic.
- If you encounter any mistakes in the logic or have any feedback, please don't hesitate to let me know by [opening an issue here](https://github.com/pseudoregalia-modding/pseudoregalia-archipelago/issues/new) or by [joining the Pseudoregalia thread in the Archipelago Discord server](https://discord.com/channels/731205301247803413/1147564210436452393).

## Other Changes
- New option: Death Link. Have fun.
- You can now toggle Solar Wind once you've obtained it by pressing the top face button on your controller (like Y or triangle), or left ctrl if you're on keyboard.
- You can now hint a random major key with simply `!hint major key` (Thanks Silent).
- "Attempting to connect" and "Connection refused" messages are now plain text instead of popups.
- The mice are still here but have overcome their shyness a bit.
- Major refactoring under the hood - hopefully you won't notice though!

## Bug Fixes
- Fixed a couple of minor memory leaks.
- Consumed small keys will no longer be restored on scene transition (Thanks spuds).
- Logic now *actually* requires all small keys instead of just 6.
- The save point in the back of Listless Library has been removed to prevent softlocks.

0.5.1.description:
## Changes
- Options are now pushed to slot data for better integration with PopTracker.

## Bug Fixes
- Theatre - Locked Door now properly requires small keys.
- The locations in the upper section of castle have been properly assigned to their new subregions.

0.5.2.description:
## Changes
- Expanded map names in locations.
- Renamed major key locations to differentiate them from the item names.
- Added a few item aliases for easier hinting, such as "Plunge", "Slidejump", and "Air Kicks".

## Bug Fixes
- The major key location for Empty Bailey is real again (Thanks Br00ty).

0.6.0.description:
## Changes
- Logic has been reworked for Dilapidated Dungeon and Listless Library. Logic Level and Obscure Logic will now apply to those regions.
- Obscure Tricks has been renamed to Obscure Logic, and its description has been adjusted to better reflect its actual effect.
  - A few Normal and Hard rules in Castle have been adjusted using Obscure Logic.
- New option: Split Sun Greaves. Provides a more gradual curve for kicks and makes library a bit more valuable.
- New option: Progressive Slide. Makes Slide a little easier to obtain.
- New option: Progressive Dream Breaker. Makes Strikebreak (and later Dream Breaker) a little easier to obtain.

## Bug fixes
- The mod will no longer confiscate small keys that you aren't supposed to have yet.
- Logic now once again considers entering the latter section of Dungeon backwards through the locked door (Thanks Br00ty).
- Internal timers have been changed to be more consistent.

0.6.1.description:
## Bug Fixes
- Message popups will now appear while paused.
- You can no longer toggle Solar Wind with only one progressive slide.
- The mice have once again been freed from their hamster balls.

0.6.2.description:
## Changes
- An Archipelago logo has been added to the top right corner of the main menu, to indicate that the AP mod is active.

## Bug Fix Fixes
- Popups will no longer appear while paused, and will wait patiently for you to unpause.

0.7.0.description:
## Changes
- The old F10 console has been replaced with a new custom console, which you can open by pressing Enter.
  - All messages will be displayed in the new console, but popups will still appear when sending or receiving items.
    - You can mute or hide these popups with the commands `/popups mute` and `/popups hide`.
  - The new console is based on the standalone text client, and includes most common commands.
  - Like the standalone text client, you can copy a message by clicking on it then pressing Ctrl+C.
  - You can close the console by pressing Escape, sending a message with Enter, or simply clicking off of it.
- To facilitate switching save files, returning to the main menu will now automatically disconnect you.
- Logic has been reworked for Sansa Keep and The Underbelly. Logic Level and Obscure Logic will now apply to those regions.
- Notable logic change: On Hard Logic and above, the player is now expected to avoid cutting platforms that make a room more difficult to traverse. In the same vein, locked doors will be in logic with only 6 keys.
- New death link messages will now be displayed when sending or receiving a death link.

## Bug Fixes
- You are no longer required to restart the game if you enter your connection info incorrectly!
- Fixed an issue where Pseudoregalia items and locations might display in other games as originating from "Generic".
- Small keys will no longer occasionally double themselves.

0.7.1.description:
## Bug Fixes
- "The Underbelly - Strikebreak Wall" now actually requires Strikebreak in logic.

0.7.2.description:
## Bug Fixes
- Fixed a logic bug where the Underbelly major key location did not always require Sunsetter.

0.7.3.description:
* Updated to using the new Options API
* Cleaned up some client documentation still referencing the old console 

Client unchanged, see https://github.com/pseudoregalia-modding/pseudoregalia-archipelago/releases for the current client files

permission to fork and release updates was granted by LittleMeowMeow so I'll continue the versioning here as well

0.7.4.description:
This release is mostly logic changes/updates from highrow
(also includes some world code refactoring but nothing player-facing)

Client unchanged, see https://github.com/pseudoregalia-modding/pseudoregalia-archipelago/releases for the current client files
0.7.4.title: Rules updates

0.8.0.description:
We finally have a new client build thanks to @highrow623 still is based off of FullGold but has some QoL features and some upkeep on the backend to keep us aligned with AP's requirements as it grows.

Changes to Client:

* Collectible overhaul
  
  * Pseudoregalia items now appear as they do in the base game. This includes your own items and items from another Pseudoregalia player that are in your world.
  * Items from other worlds appear as the Archipelago logo with an aura.
    * Progression items have the gold aura from a major key.
    * Useful/trap items have the green aura from an aspect.
    * Filler items have the pink aura from a health piece.
* Popups are now filtered to just the ones that mention the player.
* The player's name in the console is now colored differently from other players in the multiworld (like the default AP text client).
* Dependency updates
  * The client now has a preference for wss (secure) over ws when connecting to the server. Since local servers don't support secure connections, you might notice a `400 Bad Request` message in the server log and that it'll take a few seconds to connect. You can get around this by specifying protocol, e.g. `/connect ws://localhost:38281 coolPseudoPlayer`. You don't need to do this when connecting to a server on archipelago.gg.
  * Compression support (so no more warning when connecting to 0.6.0+ servers)
* Fixes a bug that would sometimes cause items or locations to have the wrong name in the console.

(apworld unchanged but attached for consistency)
0.8.0.title: New Client build!

0.8.1.description:
APWorld changes:

* Added difficulty logic to Bailey, Theatre, and Tower to complete the logic rewrite started, a while ago at this point
* Other various logic fixes and codifies Normal rules as not requiring any Ultras and Hard as only requiring backwards ultras off of Solar Wind

Client changes:

* Added client settings, which allows you to configure your client separate from the options in your player yaml file. The settings are located at `pseudoregalia/Binaries/Win64/Mods/AP_Randomizer/`. Rename the template file to `settings.toml` to have the client actually use your settings.
  * `item_display`: configures how items show up in your game
  * `death_link`: moved here from the player yaml
* Fixed a bug that added the DeathLink tag to the client even if death_link was turned off.

Thanks once again to @highrow623 for the Client updates and for helping with the logic changes
0.8.1.title: Client Settings and Full Difficulty Logic!

0.9.0.description:
# The Map Patch Update

## APWorld

* Map patch support
  * Added the `Castle Sansa - Memento` location and `Memento` item. Also added a `start_with_map` option that places Memento in your starting inventory if turned on.
  * Added time trials as locations and the new outfits as items. To make the time trial item spawn, you need to beat the bronze time (the default goal time shown when first starting the time trial).
  * Added a `randomize_time_trials` option so that the time trials are opt-in. If turned on, the outfits are also randomized. If turned off, the time trials do not have items and the outfits are instead added to your starting inventory.
  * Logic now considers geometry changes and nerfed slide ultras introduced in this version. Geometry changes relevant to logic include the reworked geometry near the entrance to the Tower and the hidden path into the Strong Eyes area of Dungeon.
* Along with support for map patch, this update maintains support for the full gold version. Use the `game_version` option to specify which version you will play. The logic, locations, and items used in generation depend on this option.
* You now spawn in Castle instead of Dungeon when loading into a new save. This was done to give you more sphere 1 checks, to allow shuffling Dream Breaker, and to make it so the trek through the Dungeon dark rooms is no longer required to access the rest of the game.
* Dream Breaker is now shuffled instead of being locked to its vanilla location. However, you can turn on the `start_with_breaker` option to start the game with it instead.
* Other logic changes
  * Since going from Dungeon to Underbelly is no longer required at the beginning of the game, entering the Dungeon dark rooms from the breakable wall in Dungeon is now considered obscure. However, if you aren't playing with obscure logic, you might still be expected to go into or through the area from Theatre or Underbelly.
  * Navigating the Dungeon dark rooms now requires nothing on expert+, meaning you might be expected to go through them without light. Similarly, throwing Dream Breaker for light is now considered obscure, so the only non-obscure thing the logic will expect for entering the area is having Ascendant Light.
  * Some Underbelly logic cleanup.

## Client/Mod

* Added compatibility with the new locations and items.
* When you connect to the server, the mod checks the version you are playing on and compares it against the `game_version` option and warns you if they don't match.
* `The Underbelly - Surrounded By Holes` spawns correctly on both versions.
* You can now save by touching a save point before you've received Dream Breaker (since you're no longer guaranteed to have Dream Breaker before getting to a save point).
* Added an integration with the PopTracker pack that can switch the zone map automatically when you go through a zone transition. (This will only happen if the `Auto Swap Map` setting is turned on in the pack.)

# Short Version

* Map patch fully supported, with time trials, new outfits, and the map
* Full gold version still supported: specify version using the `game_version` option
* `The Underbelly - Surrounded By Holes` spawns correctly on both versions.
* Spawn in Castle instead of Dungeon
* Shuffle Dream Breaker
* New options: `start_with_breaker`, `start_with_map`, `randomize_time_trials`
* Logic updates
0.9.0.title: Map Patch Patch!

0.9.1.description:
### Apworld Changes:

- New Options to randomize Goats, Chairs, Books, and Notes.
- Added Filler items ("Healing", "Magic Power") to balance the itempool when shuffling these new locations. 

### Client Changes:

- Reformatted item popups to look like the base game
- Added an icon to the HUD once you have Slide and Solar Wind; toggling just changes the icon instead of printing a message to the console
- Minor aura adjustments
- New client settings: `interactable_aura_display`, `popups.initial_state`, `popups.simplify_item_font`
0.9.1.title: Bonus Checks

0.9.2.description:
Changes:
* Added `split_cling_gem` option, which replaces the Cling Gem item with 3 Cling Shard items, each adding 2 to your wall run limit when obtained
    * When the option is turned on, there are also 2 extra checks in Tower Remains (to account for the extra items)
    * Updated the logic to consider fewer clings when evaluating rules
* The apworld now uses some 0.6.2 exclusive features, so generating will fail unless you upgrade to 0.6.2

Thanks again to @highrow623 for the updates (and release notes lol)
0.9.2.title: Split Cling!

0.9.3.description:
Small client release, adds an explicit warp to start command to prevent ever needing a new save file to get out of logical deadend softlocks.
The apworld is unchanged but included in release for convenience.

Changes

* Added a `/spawn` command to the console that will save your progress and warp you back to game start.
* Restored the save point to the back of Listless Library (since that was removed to prevent softlocks).
* Removed "proxying" server commands. Previously it was possible to input server commands with `/` (e.g. `/hint`) but now server commands must use `!`.
* Removed the `/disconnect` command. To disconnect, return to the main menu.
0.9.3.title: Warp to Spawn

0.9.4.description:
Changes: 
* Various logic updates (for full details reference the PR #31)
* Added a `major_key_hints` option:
  * If turned on, the text on the tombstones next to the Great Door will tell you where your Major Keys are located.
  * When you read the tombstones, the client will attempt to create hints:
    * If the server is version 0.6.3 or later, hints will always be created.
    * Otherwise, hints will be created only for the keys that are in your world. For keys in other players' worlds, the hint text will be printed to the console so you can copy it.
* Made a small optimization if death link is turned on that sets the `DeathLink` tag on Connect instead of waiting until Connected to update the tags.
* Fixed a bug that could cause a crash when executing the `/connect` command during an active connection (for example, when trying to connect again after inputting incorrect connect information)
0.9.4.title: Key Hints
